dashboard.addWidgetTitle: Add a widget to the dashboard
dashboard.shareTitle: Share this dashboard with a colleague
dashboard.shareSuccess: Share link copied to your clipboard
dashboard.shareError: Share link could not be copied to your clipboard: {url}
dashboard.manualTitle: A manual layout allows positioning the widgets freely in the dashboard
dashboard.autoTitle: An automatic layout compacts the view to the top-left corner, when space is available
dashboard.fixedTitle: A fixed layout prevents any changes to the dashboard
dashboard.deleteConfirmMessage: Are your sure you want to delete the dashboard "{dashboard}"?
dashboard.saveAsTitle: Save the dashboard to open it later
dashboard.saveAsModalMessage: Enter a name for this dashboard
dashboard.setDefaultConfirm: Do you want to set "{dashboard}" as the default dashboard?
dashboard.setDefaultSuccess: "{dashboard}" was set as the default dashboard
dashboard.renameWidgetMessage: Enter a new name for this widget

queryTotalTimeLine.info: Number of search queries over time.

userTotalTimeLine.info: Number of unique user-id over time.

userCountTotal.info: Total number of unique user-id having completed a session with search.

sessionTotalTimeLine.info: Number of unique session over time. WARNING: If a user is navigating from 11:49 pm to 0:10, we will consider there are 2 different sessions. It allows to simplify the calculation by day.

avgClicksByQueryTimeLine.info: Average number of clicked documents by search query, over time.

avgQueriesBySessionTimeLine.info: Average number of search queries per session, over time.

avgEngineResponseTimeTimeLine.info: Average engine response time (in ms), over time.

avgResponseTimeTimeLine.info: Average response time (in ms) incl. platform & engine, over time.

avgResponseTime.info: Average response time (in ms) incl. platform & engine.

maxEngineResponseTimeTimeLine.info: Maximum engine response time (in ms), over time.

maxResponseTimeTimeLine.info: Maximum Response time (in ms) incl. platform & engine, over time.

avgMRRTimeLine.info: Captures the rank of doc clicked by users: first doc = 1, second doc = 1/2, third doc = 1/3...  and zero if there is no click.

avgMRR.info: Captures the rank of doc clicked by users, over time: first doc = 1, second doc = 1/2, third doc = 1/3...  and zero if there is no click.

clickRank1TotalTimeLine.info: Number of search queries where the user clicks on the first document, over time.

clickRank1TotalRate.info: Number of search queries where the user clicks on the first document out of the total number of searches.

clickRank3TimeLine.info: Number of search queries where the user clicks on one of the first 3 documents, over time.

clickRank3.info: Number of search queries where the user clicks on one of the first 3 documents.

clickTotalTimeLine.info: Total number of documents clicked, over time.

newUsersTimeLine.info: Users that logged in for the first time, over time

newUsers.info: Users that have logged in for the first time in the current period

queryBounceTimeLine.info: Number of bounces, over time. A bounce is when a user opens a document and quickly comes back (<10s).

queryBounce.info: Total number of bounces. A bounce is when a user opens a document and quickly comes back (<10s).

queryBounceRate.info: Number of bounces compared to the total number of search queries.

queryClickTimeLine.info: Number of search queries where the user has clicked on a document at least once, over time.

queryClick.info: Total number of search queries where the user has clicked on a document at least once.

queryClickRate.info: Number of search queries where the user has clicked on a document at least once compared to the total number of searches.

queryRefineTimeLine.info: Number of search queries where the user has refined the search (through facets for instance), over time.

queryRefine.info: Total number of search queries where the user has refined the search (through facets for instance).

queryRefineRate.info: Number of search queries where the user has refined the search compared to the total number of searches.

queryZeroTimeLine.info: Number of search queries without any results, over time.

queryZero.info: Total number of search queries without any results.

queryZeroRate.info: Number of search queries without any results compared to the total number of search.

activeUsers.info: Users that had at least two sessions with search queries during the current period (and this is not their first connection).

active_newUsers.info: Number of new users compared to the total number of active users.

searchExitTimeLine.info: Number of search queries where the user does nothing after viewing the results page, over time.

searchExit.info: Total number of search queries where the user does nothing after viewing the results page.

searchExitRate.info: Number of search queries where the user does nothing after viewing the results page compared to the total number of searches.

queryByResult.info:
Last action after a search:
 - 'search.exit.logout': Runs a search, does not click on any document, logs out.
 - 'search.exit.timeout': Runs a search, does not click on a document, leaves the page.
 - 'search.with.click': Runs one or several searches, clicks on a document as a last action.
 - 'search.with.no.click':  Runs one or several searches, does not click on any document as a last action.

topNoResultQueries.info: Most frequent search queries without any results.

sessionsByUser.info: Average number of sessions per user.

avgQueriesBySession.info: Average number of searches per session.

avgClicksByQuery.info: Average number of clicked documents per search.

docViewsBySession.info: Average number of viewed documents (Document Navigator) per search.

userFeedbackGrid.info: User messages sent via the Feedback widget

trendsCalculations.title: Trends calculations
trendsCalculations.label: Use the preceding period of same duration
trendsCalculations.tooltip: For example, if  "Last 6 months " is selected above, trends will be automatically computed against the previous 6 months period.
trendsCalculations.customPeriodTooltip: This period is used a baseline to measure the evolution of the metrics displayed in the dashboard.
